verb.description: Pass again, especially on the way back.
examples: the courtyard where people pass and repass on errands of their own devising
as he repassed the gate a few seconds later, I called out to him

verb.description: Pass (a rival) for a second or further time in a race or other competition.
examples: he repassed Vettel and romped home to his seventh victory of the season

verb.description: Pass (legislation) in an amended form or under changed conditions.
examples: Congress repassed the statute with the added interstate commerce clause

origin: Late Middle English: from Old French repasser.
